page.title: 19LAUGHARNE'S SOCIAL CONCERNS
page.content: Laugharne has a noticeably lower rate of referrals to Carmarthen's geriatric specialist, and there are very few residents in local Old Peoples' Homes. No children have been taken into care although one or two cases may involve Social Workers. People are, today, relatively affluent and well-housed, although about 20 children receive free dinners in the Primary school and in the District 60% of Council tenants get Rent Rebates. There have been only 2 suicides in the past few years. Laugharne Civic Trust Society (member- ship 180) tries to conserve the peace and beauty of Laugharne by objecting to extensions of caravan-sites, amuse- ment arcades and such like develop- ments, also to filling in of the creek on the salt-marsh which is changing the maritime character of the estuary. The Society has surveyed 22 footpaths.
